item.title: Computer Networks - Lecture 03
item.description: Basic model of (tele)communication participants act either as a sender or receiver usage of the service occurs at a special interface (API) and by using a service address point the medium bridges the spatial (raeumlich) distance The following image shows a layer model which shows the reduction of deficits from bottom to top: There are certain principles to structure communication. These principles are also called communication protocols or short protocols and define a set of rules which communication between two or more parties has to follow/obey.

item.title: Computer Networks - Lecture 02
item.description: Back to the roots of the Internet The internet consists of a set of computers which use the same network protocol (TCP/IP) are somehow (directly or indirectly) connected to each other offer or use certain services a set of (human or technical) users which access and use services and a set of further networks accessible via gateways The most commonly used Internet services are: World Wide Web (www) platform for hypermedial information exchange based on the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) Email exchange of multimedial messages based on the Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) File Exchange access and transmission of files based on File Transfer Protocol (FTP) Network Management surveillance and control of connected systems based on Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Model of a simple transmission system:
